instructions.1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add apples briefly, using a slotted spoon, to remove any wax that may be present. Wipe dry; set aside to cool. Insert sticks into apples through cores.
instructions.2: Place unwrapped caramels and 2 tablespoons water into a microwave-safe medium bowl. Cook on High for 2 minutes; stir. Continue cooking and stirring at 1 minute intervals until caramel is melted and smooth.
instructions.3: Line a baking sheet with waxed paper; coat with cooking spray. Hold apples by sticks; dip into caramel to coat. Set on waxed paper; refrigerate to set, about 15 minutes.
instructions.4: Microwave chocolate and 1 tablespoon shortening in a microwave-safe bowl until melted and smooth. Dip apples into chocolate to cover caramel layer; return to waxed paper to set.
instructions.5: Place candy melts and remaining 1 tablespoon shortening in a micro-wave safe bowl; microwave, stirring every 30 seconds, until smooth. Use a fork or wooden stick to drizzle melted candy melt in a colorful design onto coated apples. Refrigerate until set, overnight is better.

questions.question: In Step 4, is the apples from Step 1 being used?
Is apples from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is caramel from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is chocolate from Step 4 still available in Step 5?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 3?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to hold the apples in Step 3?
Can we bring (Step 1) and place (Step 2) at the same time?
